intro: Aulomyrcia tobagensis, commonly known as the Toba Guanacaste, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region, particularly found in parts of Colombia and Venezuela. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes trees and shrubs characterized by their often aromatic wood and distinctive leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, followed by winged fruits that aid in seed dispersal. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in dry or semi-deciduous forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
